It works with Firefox 3.6.3 and Download Helper 4.7.3.
No virus, tested and working on Windows 7 64bit
For people who can't read that language in the help file, here's a brief explanation:

1. Open the "addon-3006-latest.xpi with firefox by either dragging it over the firefox icon, or double clicking, select choose file to open, navigate to the mozilla installation directory, and select firefox. After that it should install the addon. Now as of today that's the current addon so you could just download it from their site and it might work, idk i havent't tried it.

2. Next close firefox and install the converthelpersetup.exe
3. once it's done, navigate to:

C:\Users\YOURUSERNAMEHERE\AppData\Roaming\Mozilla\Firefox\Profiles

Replace the "YOURUSERNAMEHERE" with whatever your username is.

There should be a folder that looks like "XXXXXXXX.default" with the in my case it was: m5u6xvjo.default

Open that folder and then navigate from there to: 

\extensions\{b9db16a4-6edc-47ec-a1f4-b86292ed211d}\components

Then copy the "dhConvertMgr.js" and paste it in the same directory. Rename the copy to "dhConvertMgr.jsBAK" without the quotes. After that move and replace the "dhConvertMgr.js" from the crack folder to the folder you navigated to. 

You're done. Open firefox and enjoy.

To remove it just navigate back, delete the "dhConvertMgr.js" file and change the name of "dhConvertMgr.jsBAK" to what it was before (dhConvertMgr.js)

^lithoxene: once you downloaded all the files, the crack file is located inside the crack folder.  Copy that file onto the folder \components to overwrite the original file if you didn't rename it.  If you rename the original file, just copy and paste into the \components folder.
